pageContent: LOGINLOGOUTHELPPrinter FriendlyPageEarthfiles, news category.Share:DiggFacebookStumbleUponTwo Bulls and Several Cows Dead and Mutilatedin Manitoba, Canada © 2007 by Linda Moulton Howe“I’ve had dead animals before, but I’ve never seen them like this.And then Greg (Wotowich) lost his bull and just recently, Lois and Steve Matislost one of their cows. The teats on theirs was cut off in circles just like mine.”- Sheila Vigfusson, Manitoba RancherAugust 17, 2007 Komarno and Gimli, Manitoba, Canada - The modern era ofworldwide animal mutilations goes back to the 1960s. Canada had as many reports as theUnited States. For example, in August 1967, exactly forty years ago, on the SarceeReserve near Twin Bridges in Alberta, a dead horse was found where a witness claimed a“domed saucer craft” had been seen earlier that day.Then three months later in early November 1967, two horses were found dead nearLivingston, Ontario. One had a long, bloodless cut on its neck. The other had its throat andjugular vein cut off, yet there was no evidence of blood. That was November 6, 1967. Theday before, near Livingston, a resident reported seeing a large UFO.Since then, literally thousands of animals – including wild game and all kinds of domesticstock – have been found with a similar pattern of bloodless excisions: an ear is cut offclose to the scalp. On the same side of the head, an eye is often removed along with acircular excision of hide around the eye. Half the jaw flesh is cut out along with the entiretongue from deep within the throat. In almost all cases, genitals are excised in neat oval orcircular hide-deep patterns and often the rectum and/or vaginal tissue is cored out as well.All without blood or signs of struggle. 7 Cows, 2 Calves and 1 Bull Die Mysteriouslyin Komarno, ManitobaGimli, Manitoba, Canada (pink circle) is about 50 miles north of Winnipegand has a population of 6,000. A couple miles away, 125 residents live in thesmall farm town of Komarno, which means "mosquito" in Ukrainian.And now come more cattle mutilation reports in the province of Manitoba between July 8and August 9. Sheila Vigfusson has lived and farmed in Komarno the past twelve years.She runs a herd of 300 cattle, about half male and half female. Komarno is a very smallrural community only a couple of miles from Gimli, which has a population of about 6,000.Both towns are near Lake Winnipeg north of Winnipeg, Manitoba. And this summer, bothtowns are now on the animal mutilation map.

On July 8, Sheila found five of her adult cows and two calves dead with odd, bloodlessexcisions of hide and circular excisions of teats from the udders. Her vet came out to gettissue samples to send to a Canadian lab testing for anthrax. That dreaded disease hadsuddenly appeared in Komarno and Gimli, much to the shock of farmers and ranchers whohad never had to deal with anthrax before.The next day, on July 9, Sheila found another dead cow. Then two days after that on July11, she found another cow and one of her bulls mutilated. None had any blood on oraround them. Most had the odd circular excisions of hide from their bloated bodies. Sheilawas very confused and troubled because anthrax causes animals to bleed.When she got the tissue test results back, none of her animals had tested positive foranthrax, but she still had a total of 10 dead animals, cause of death unknown, and an 11thmissing that never turned up. Sheila told me, "Now I wish I had taken photographs, but Iwas so upset and so confused about what was happening that I didn't even want to look atmy dead animals."Sheila Vigfusson, Rancher, Komarno, Manitoba, Canada: “It’s just so weird to me.What gets me is that I have ten animals dead and I don’t know what they died from. AndI’ve never seen this (dead animals) with no blood. We’ve been farming a long time andhave quite a lot of cattle. I’ve had dead animals before, but I’ve never seen them like this,you know? And then Greg (Wotowich) lost his bull and just recently, Lois and Steve Matislost one of their cows. The teats on theirs was cut off in circles just like mine." A 2,700-Pound-Bull Is Mutilatedin Gimli, ManitobaTwo and a half weeks later on July 29, only a couple of miles down the road from Sheila'splace, Greg Woytowich was working on Sunday afternoon, July 29, around 3:30 PM. Gregis 42-years-old and has farmed in Gimli the past eleven years. One of his prize purchasestwo years ago was a 10-year-old pedigreed black Angus bull from Scotland. That bullweighed 2,700 pounds and was the best bull Greg had ever owned.That hot, sunny day, Greg and his brother were bailing hay. Greg had just started makinghis first found of the pasture when he was perplexed about what he was seeing sticking upfrom pasture grass about two hundred feet away.Greg Woytowich, Farmer and Mechanic for the Province of Manitoba NaturalResources Department, Gimli, Manitoba, Canada: “I made the corner with the tractorand bailer and I looked over to my right. I seen a leg sticking up out of the tall grass and araven flew up.So, I stopped the tractor and went over the fence and walked out approximately 60 yardsfrom the fence and there was my bull lying on the ground. His head was facing north andhis legs were facing east. I walked up to (his back) and figured, ‘Oh, crap!’ because we hadanthrax break out in the area. So I left (without looking at bull closely) and phoned theveterinarian to come out and take samples from him. And I was cheesed off! (laughs) But Ifigured there was no use standing around. The bull’s dead, so I got back in the tractor andcontinued to bail.It was about 90 minutes from the time I discovered the bull until the vet showed up thatSunday. Then, we returned back to where the bull was and now I noticed he was missinghis skin on his abdomen and his scrotum was cut out and I noticed his ear and tongue weregone.

Right ear cut off at its base and tongue removed. Right eye never examinedto see if intact or not. The depression in neck is where the veterinarian on Sunday,July 29, 2007, took a sample for anthrax lab tests which came back negative.Image © 2007 by Greg Woytowich.Bull's scrotum and penis were removed in large oval, hide-deep excision.The remaining internal penile tissue fell out onto the bull's left rear leg througha second hole in the bull's lower abdomen. Image © 2007 by Greg Woytowich.I said to the vet, ‘You know, this is kind of weird. What’s with this?’He looked and just said, ‘Oh, it’s just wildlife. Animals were getting at him.’ He took asample from the neck (depression on neck in top photo) as a tissue sample and that was it.I asked, ‘Can I bury him?’He said, ‘No, we have to send the test in, so he’s not going anywhere – just leave himthere.’I found that odd if it’s a suspicion of anthrax. There’s certain things you have to do withanthrax-infected animals. But that was it. I was cheesed off, my bull was dead, he took thesamples, I closed the gate and carried on.In the meantime, since it was a Sunday, I talked to another vet I have used and usuallydeal with. And he contacted me Monday morning and asked what had happened. I toldhim and said this Dr. Katreece (first vet on Sunday) had come out and taken samples.Now, this vet on Monday told me I should get in contact with Dr. Megan Bergman, incharge of the anthrax outbreak with Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFI).So I contacted her and she asked, ‘Have you covered him with a tarp?’ She said, ‘Do thatas soon as possible. Why cover with the tarp is because if it is anthrax, you basically cookthe anthrax (spores) under the tarp in the hot weather we were having and it kills thespores.

Greg Realizes Missing Tissue from BullWas Cut with Sharp InstrumentSo, I went back to the pasture on the afternoon of Monday (July 30, 2007), and I took atarp and I covered him. But as I pulled the tarp over, I started looking more closely and gota really good look at the front of him and thought, ‘There is something wrong here!’ So, Iphoned the vet back and said, ‘I was tarping him to cover him up and those are not wildlifewounds or whatever you want to call them.’ I’ve butchered my own animals for beef andI’ve been skinning steers since I was 8-years-old. There’s a way that hide is taken awayand you can tell it’s been skinned.So I was telling the vet this and basically he gave me a blast back. He said, ‘No one hastouched that animal. Wildlife did that and on and on and on.I said, ‘OK, fine!’ But I went to work – I work for Natural Resources for Province ofManitoba – and my district supervisor, he’s been a game warden for 30 years. And I wastelling him about this. And he said he had heard something not too long ago in Rivertonwhere a rancher lost a bull that was mutilated.So, Irwin says to me, ‘Come on. I’ll bring my camera and let’s go take a look.’So we went out to the bull and uncovered him and Irwin is looking and says, ‘Geez, youknow’ – he’s been all over the place and a game warden for 30 years. He said, ‘I’ve seencaribou, I’ve seen moose – I’ve seen everything eaten from wildlife. And there’s nobloody way in the world that that’s wildlife.’So he said, ‘If I were you, I would get hold of the RCMP.’ (Royal Canadian MountedPolice)So, I phoned the RCMP – this was a couple of days after – and they did not soundsurprised or shocked. They didn’t call me an idiot over the phone by no means. They werejust interested in the location of the animal. They wanted to go take pictures to comparethem with some other photos that they had.THAT WERE ALSO CURRENT NOW?Yeah. Or with what they have on file. I’m not sure. But they went out and when theypulled the tarp off, the bull was white and crawling with maggots and like typical cops,they just put the tarp back over him. But they requested that I give them copies of myphotographs. So, I went and did that. The bull was lying out there and the tests came backnegative.IT CAME BACK NEGATIVE FOR ANTHRAX?Right, the first tests were negative, but Dr. Bergman’s reason was the state of decay thatthe bull was in – that they could not get an accurate test. They had to send it to a betterlab. So she went and sent the samples to another lab.In the meantime, the authorities came out. I had the hole dug already and we treated it as apositive anthrax case. They never even took the tarp off of him. They just sprayedeverything down with disinfectant and I pushed him in the hole and buried him.Now, I had my photos and that’s when I went to show them to Sheila because I heard shehad lost a bunch of cows. She was actually just finishing burying some.She said, ‘I thought I was crazy. Some of mine were cut. One was missing a tongue, onewas missing an ear, and the teats were cut off.’ But she said, ‘I didn’t want to say nothingbecause everyone is going to say I’m looney, eh!’I said, ‘No. Look at my pictures. This isn’t wildlife. There’s no way in hell!’A week later she came and got my pictures and emailed them to you to get your opinion.IT’S A CLASSIC ANIMAL MUTILATION."

Oval-shaped gouge penetrated about three inches into the "armpit" regionof the left front leg. Image © 2007 by Greg Woytowich.Over my years of animal mutilation investigations, some of the more puzzling details arebloodless puncture holes or gouges in the hide. Gregg Woytowich's bull had a deep gougein the armpit of his left front leg.Rancher Greg Woytowich poking stick into the odd, oval gouge near his bull's front left leg"armpit." Greg said the stick penetrated about three inches. Cause and purpose of the bloodlessgouge is unknown, but similar "biopsies" of tissue have been observed in manyother animal mutilations over the past half century. Image © 2007 by Greg Woytowich.Greg Woytowich: "Yeah, I seen that. In this photo, I was poking in there with a stick. Iwas seeing how deep it was.HOW DEEP DID THE STICK GO?Probably three inches.THOSE KINDS OF DETAILS HAVE BEEN FOUND ON BODIES IN WHICH WHENNECROPSIES WERE DONE, THE HEART HAS BEEN FOUND COMPLETELYMISSING FROM INSIDE THE PERICARDIUM WITHOUT ANY CUTS OR TEARS INTHE PERICARDIUM. THAT IS WORK WITH A TECHNOLOGY WE HUMANS DONOT HAVE.Exactly. I was laughing seeing these pictures and I said, ‘Who knows, maybe aliens!’(laughs) THAT’S WHAT GOVERNMENT PEOPLE TELL ME IT IS.And people look at me kind of funny and start laughing and I say, 'If you think we are theonly ones that walk on a planet in this universe, you’re very naive.'

WHAT I’M TRYING TO UNDERSTAND IS: OUR GOVERNMENT APPARENTLYLINKS GLOBAL ANIMAL MUTILATIONS AND WHAT HAPPENED TO YOUR BULLIN THEIR OWN DOCUMENTS, THEY CALL THEM ‘EXTRATERRESTRIALBIOLOGICAL ENTITIES.’ THE QUESTION IS: WHY? WHAT IS THIS HUGEHARVEST OF MATERIAL FROM ALL THESE ANIMALS AROUND THE WORLDTHAT’S BEEN GOING ON FOR AT LEAST A CENTURY – WHY?Yeah, and you know when I was talking with a constable at the RCMP, He said, ‘I don’tknow what it is, but these animal mutilations in this area (of Manitoba) say within 100square miles, there are always reports at this time of year.’AND FROM YOUR BULL, WHAT YOU KNOW WAS CUT OUT WAS THE RIGHTEAR DOWN TO ITS BASE. THE TONGUE WAS GONE. THE BELLY TISSUE THATWOULD HAVE SURROUNDED THE EXIT OF HIS PENIS AND TESTICLES WASREMOVED IN A VERY LARGE OVAL.AND A SECOND HOLE WAS MADE INTO THE BACK ABDOMEN AREA WHERETHE INTERNAL PENILE TISSUE IS FALLING OUT OF THE ANIMAL.Yeah.THE RECTUM WAS INTACT?Yes and untouched.Rear of 2,700-pound bull with white tarp on left, rectum not touched.Image © 2007 by Greg Woytowich.GREG, WHAT DO YOU THINK ABOUT WHY ANTHRAX SHOULD SUDDENLYSHOW UP IN YOUR AREA WHERE THERE ARE ANIMAL MUTILATIONS AT THESAME TIME?Right, this is a weird, weird situation. As I said, I’m a fourth generation farmer. We’ve hadcattle all along. I’ve never, ever in this area – I would say within 100 square miles – we’venever had anthrax.WHY NOW?Yeah, and why now?LOIS SAID THE SAME THING. SHE ALSO SAID THAT AUTHORITIES ARE TRYINGTO BLAME THE CONSTRUCTION OF A HYDRO ELECTRIC LINE AND THATSTIRRED UP THE SOIL ?Yeah, well, that’s bullshit! (laughs) First of all, they did not disturb the soil. All they didwas go through there with a hydro ax and just mowed the bush down. They never touchedthe ground. Non-Human Mutilation Perpetrators?IF NON-HUMANS WERE THE ONES INVOLVED IN THE MANITOBA ANIMALDEATHS IN THE LAST FOUR WEEKS, WOULD THEY BE THERE BECAUSEANTHRAX IS SUDDENLY FLOURISHING AND THE ALIENS ARE MONITORINGSOMETHING? THESE ARE THE MYSTERIES. WHY THE FOCUS IN EXACTLY THE

SPOT WHERE ANTHRAX HAS BROKEN OUT, BUT YOU HAVE NEVER SEENBEFORE?I am very open minded about that. As I said, if people think we’re the only living creaturesin this universe, they are very naive and sadly mistaken.RIGHT, AND WHEN YOU THINK ABOUT THAT – THAT NON-HUMANS AREINVOLVED WITH THE GLOBAL HARVESTING OF GENETIC MATERIAL, FLUIDSAND ALL OF THAT, FROM ANIMALS AROUND THE WORLD - INCLUDINGHORSES, CATTLE, GOATS, SHEEP, WILD GAME – WHAT ARE YOU LEFT WITHAS A RESIDUE IN YOUR OWN THOUGHTS ABOUT THAT?Maybe they have an agenda they are following, too, just like anyone else, like I’m thecattle farmer and that’s my agenda. If there is someone from other planets flying aroundand need this (from animals), heck – all you have to do is stop and ask. (laughs) I’m surewe could work something out!GREG, I COMPLETELY AGREE WITH YOUR ATTITUDE AND IT HAS ALWAYSPUZZLED ME ABOUT WHY OUR ELECTED OFFICIALS TAKE THE HARDHANDED APPROACH THAT THE PUBLIC AND MEDIA WILL PANIC IF WELEARN WHAT THEY KNOW. I THINK THAT IS UNDERMINING OUR ABILITY TOBE VOTING PUBLICS WITH GOVERNMENTS THAT WE TRUST. NOBODY TRUSTSTHE GOVERNMENTS NOW BECAUSE EVERY GOVERNMENT IS LYING TO US.Oh, I know! It doesn’t matter if you’re the United States or Canada or Paraguay or whothe hell ever! It’s all the same crap.IF GOVERNMENTS DID LEVEL WITH EVERYONE AND THERE WAS SOME WAYTO NEGOTIATE WITH SOME HUMANS: ‘OK, YOU NEED X ANIMALS. WELL, WEHAVE TO PAY OUR FARMERS. SO, YOU DO THIS FOR US IN A TRADE DEAL.Right. You know what gets me? We have slaughtering plants. Instead of mutilating out inthe pastures, you could put one of your own (alien) people there (in the slaughter house)and as they go down the line, they could sample this, that and other things.RIGHT!Here you go, take it. But don’t kill my bull out in the pasture! (laughs)YOU ARE MAKING AN EXCELLENT POINT. AND ALL THE SECRECY ANDCOVER-UP INTERFERES WITH WHAT COULD BE A REASONABLE ANDLOGICAL APPROACH TO THEIR ALIEN NEEDS, OUR NEEDS, AND IT COULD BEA WIN/WIN INSTEAD OF THE SCARY, DESTRUCTIVE SECRECY.Yeah, exactly. And if they (aliens) have the technology to come and visit us wheneverthey want, I could probably assume they could wipe out humankind with the flick of abutton.THE FACT THAT THEY DON’T MEANS THAT IS NOT WHAT THEY WANT.That’s right." August 9, 2007 - Another Cow Mutilation in KimarnoOn the Lois and Steve Matis FarmThe same day that Greg Woytowich found his prize bull dead, one of his cows gave birthto a male calf sired by that mutilated bull. So, now Greg is going to watch the new calfgrow up, hoping he will match his father's physical greatness - and not be selected asanother prime mutilation specimen.Greg told me that only four miles down the road from his farm back in Komarno, Lois andSteve Matis also lost a cow to the strange bloodless excisions. Lois confirmed that on themorning of August 9, 2007, she found one of her best 9-year-old cows dead and mutilated- a cow she had seen alive in the early evening the night before.Lois Matis, Farmer, Komarno, Manitoba, Canada: “Her ear was missing and all fourteats were missing. When we got looking closer, the ear was definitely cut. You could seethe mark where when you cut into the hide, the white part inside the hide, you could see itvery visibly. The two teats that were on the top, definitely looked cut. The bottom two –it’s hard to say.

The 9-year-old cow's four teats were removed. The top one in photograph had been neatlycut out leaving an oval excision (see close-up below). The nearby teat was cut, but not as neatly.The bottom two teats, in contrast, were ragged and bleeding. Image © 2007 by Lois Matis.Close-up neatly excised teat from Matis cow.Image © 2007 by Lois Matis.The Matis cow's right ear had been removed, leaving the ear tagand a gelatinous blood mass. Black anthrax tarp covers frontof cow's head. Image © 2007 by Lois Matis.I AGREE. THE TOP TWO HAVE THE CIRCULAR EXCISIONS SEEN IN OTHERMUTILATIONS. THE BOTTOM TWO COULD BE PREDATOR. IT'S CONFUSING.The Canadian Food Inspectors (CFI) came out to spray with an anthrax spore poison onour dead cow.DID THEY COMMENT ABOUT THE STRANGE EXCISIONS OF THE EAR ANDTEATS?They asked if someone had come and taken samples because CFI does cut an ear off fortests. We said that nobody had been there. My husband, Steve, said to him, ‘Doesn’t itlook like these were cut off?’ The CFI guy answered, ‘Yeah, I kind of thought so, but I

didn’t want to say anything.’ ”More Information:If viewers have more information about unusual, bloodless animal deaths in your area,please email me at earthfiles@earthfiles.comFor further reports about animal mutilations, please see reports below in the EarthfilesArchive and my books An Alien Harvest and the 2-volume Glimpses of Other Realities inthe Earthfiles Shop:• 07/13/2007 — Iowa Minister Reports Large "Crab/Scorpion" Creature Attacked Cow• 06/25/2007 — Updated: Half Cat in Waco, Texas, and Kangaroo Mutilations in New South Wales, Australia• 05/29/2007 — Final Part 7: Eyewitness Links Animal Mutilations to Non-Humans• 05/25/2007 — Update: Part 1, Unusual Animal Deaths• 05/13/2007 — Part 6: Eyewitness Links Animal Mutilations to Non-Humans• 05/06/2007 — Part 5: Eyewitness Links Animal Mutilations to Non-Humans• 05/05/2007 — Part 4: Eyewitness Links Animal Mutilations to Non-Humans• 04/28/2007 — April 24, 2007 - Part 3: Eyewitness Links Animal Mutilations to Non-Humans.• 04/19/2007 — Part 2: Eyewitness Links Animal Mutilations to Non-Humans• 04/18/2007 — Part 1: Eyewitness Links Animal Mutilations to Non-Humans• 04/09/2007 — More Cat Mutilations - This Time in Corpus Christi, Texas• 11/24/2006 — Scientific Data Supports Theory That Mutilated Montana Cow Dropped from Sky andBounced• 11/16/2006 — Pregnant Cows Disappear in Ohio; Horses Beheaded in Vancouver• 10/19/2006 — Another Cattle Mutilation in Pondera County, Montana• 10/02/2006 — Unusual Deaths of Six Female Goats in White Salmon, Washington• 09/20/2006 — Animal Mutilations Increase Again in Argentina• 09/05/2006 — Part 2: "Alphonso Lorenzo" - Military Visitor to Another Planet?• 09/04/2006 — Part 1: "Alphonso Lorenzo" - Military Visitor to Another Planet?• 08/23/2006 — More Cat and Dog Mutilations• 07/01/2006 — Cattle Mutilation and Glowing Discs in Saskatchewan, Canada• 06/29/2006 — Another Horse Suspended in the Air• 06/28/2006 — Half Cats in Destin, Florida, and Beheaded Animals in Rochester, N.
